SENT.plain: We report a three generation pedigree with 11 of 22 affected with a variant form of rolandic epilepsy, speech impairment, oromotor apraxia, and cognitive deficit
The core features comprised nocturnal rolandic seizures, interictal centrotemporal spike waves with early age of onset and late age of offset
The transmission of the phenotype was consistent with autosomal dominant inheritance, with variable expressivity but no evidence of anticipation
We found evidence that the seizure and speech traits may be dissociated
No abnormalities were found by cytogenetic analysis
Linkage analysis excluded loci at 11p, 15q, 16p12, and Xq22 for related phenotypes, suggesting genetic heterogeneity
